title: Tallahasse
description: Dwight refuses to let appendicitis get in the way of leading his new team in Tallahassee, while Andy decides to step in for Erin as secretary in the office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Today is the first day of Sabre's new project to develop a chain of retail stores. I am meeting my new boss, Nellie Bertram, head of special projects. Work starts at nine. Sabre HQ is thirty minutes away, driving the speed limit. Giving everyone twenty minutes to shower, plus fifty for Jim to style his hair, twenty for breakfast, forty for Erin to get lost between her room and the lobby, ninety for Ryan to do his morning ecstasy... We're already twenty minutes late.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wake up! [Cathy screams]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey, hey! Wake up! [Erin kicks him] Ow! Why are you sleeping that way?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. I was reading the mattress tag and I fell asleep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stanley! Wake up! You've got to wake up, the hotel's on fire!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Stanley, wake up, it's pretzel day! [Dwight pinches Stanley's nose and covers his mouth]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mmm! [struggles] Ugh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [lets go] Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, wake up. Let's have some fun. We're in Florida now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, you. I'm so glad this is happening. I actually came to your door twice last night. Come on in, the water's fine. [sees Dwight] Oh, not cool!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am on the two kid sleep schedule so I'm up and at 'em at four fifteen, but no kids, so I honestly didn't know what to do with myself, and then I thought of something. Uh- [hears door, hides]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Heeeere's Dwi- what the-? [sees trashed room] Oh man.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What do you think happened?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Looks like Jim got mixed up with some bad apples. [sees "IT WAS DWIGHT" written in lipstick on the door] Oh no, no, no, no. It wasn't me. I gotta find Luwanda at The Alcohol Club. Oh. [Jim falls out of the closet, Erin and Dwight scream]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Puppet.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: Cool, for your kids?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. It's weird being away from them. Never done this before.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention, Dunder Mifflin group. Proceed outside. The vehicle is waiting. Seats have been assigned. Shotgun goes to Ryan. Congratulations, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need to make Nellie see me as a leader today. First impressions get locked in forever. When I first met Pam, she said something that slightly rubbed me the wrong way. Since then I've loved working with Pam and she's frankly wonderful, but I hate her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll have a bottle of the antacid. Also, I want to get a souvenir for my son, but his mother doesn't acknowledge my paternity. Do you have anything for that? Also, I want it to have a Florida feel.

quotes.speaker: Saleswoman
quotes.text: What does he like?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Power.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, and this one is, "Huh. Don't see too many museums around here."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, Twiggy, that's enough. Get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm fine, okay? It's just stress. You know, 'cause I care about this project. And frankly the fact that none of you are vomiting or diarrheal right now I find very alarming.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who says none of us are diarrheal?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you sure it's stress? Because I did poison you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very funny, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, I'm serious. I was thinking, "For this trip I have to do something epic, so what should that be?" and then I thought of it. I'll poison you. What are you gonna do? You gonna steal my newspaper or put a cricket in my cereal or something?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna set your face on fire.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's a good one. [a red sports car drives up] Whoa, Stanley! Did you just come back from burning down a rival nightclub?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Laugh it up, Halpert. I'm in Florida for a month without my family. I'm gonna enjoy this. Want to get in? You can work the iPod.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You're a nice guy, Jim, but you have no idea how to vacation. Find some Kenny Loggins.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Loggins and Messina.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Did I say "Messina?" [tires screech]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ahh! [laughs] Sorry I couldn't resist. It's so quiet.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I like it. It's so peaceful, I've already written like, twelve plays today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's so quiet, one might say, you could hear a pin... [drops pin] I thought that would be cooler.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I loved it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, can you pick up the pin? Some of us like to work in our bare feet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of course, I will pick up the pin. It is right here. Got it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can we see that? Did you really find it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, right here. Got it. Dink, ow. [chuckles, clicks tongue] In the trash.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, why is it so quiet? Shouldn't the phone be ringing? Uh-oh. Erin set the phone to voicemail.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oh great. [overlapping chatter]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: We're screwed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There. [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh! There we go! Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can you get the phone?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well I'm not the receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm, well, you used to be.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know, but I can't cover reception. I have a ton of work to do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Phone's ringing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Will one of you get the phone? I am freaking out! I know it's for me. [Andy and Pam silently argue] Are you guys kidding me? Stop flirting and someone get the phone!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Somebody! Answer the phone.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Andy, pick up the phone!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Get the damn phone.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You're the closest one to it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine. Hello, Dunder Mifflin. [ringing continues] Hello, you've reached Dunder Mifflin. How may I be of service?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Man.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: How was the drive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fantastic. Stanley drives so fast.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Life is short. "Drive fast and leave a sexy corpse." That's one of my mottoes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I would love to hear the other mottos.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Quick query, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No way.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Still queer?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Packer.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: You can't put me down. Too strong!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Yeah, Dwight and Jim tried to get me fired, but I landed on my feet down here in Florida. You see, this cat's got nine lives, and a nine-inch-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Psst. Say, "So who's leading this thing, anyway?"

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So who's leading this thing, anyway?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Psst. Say, "I can't wait to meet him."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can't wait to meet him.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Him, you say? Don't think a woman can be a leader?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You poor, simple boy. Expected a man, did you? Strong, powerful. Huge, whopping penis? Well, sorry to disappoint, but my huge, whopping penis is right here, [points to her head] and I'm not afraid to use it. So stop looking at my breasts, and start looking at my penis. [slow clap] I'm Nellie Bertram, president of special projects. In the next few weeks we're going to throw everything you know about business out of the window and do it our own way. Are your minds blown? So, how did this special project come about anyway? Well, I interviewed to be the manager of your branch. [points to Jim] After you decided I wasn't "a good fit-"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ah! It was. I went on a shopping spree. Very destructive. I bought thirteen pianos. Then I realized, what if Sabre had a store? Hmm? So I called Jo, old friend, founder of Sabre, and I told her and she grabbed me by the shoulders and she said, "Yes!" So let's talk about the Sabre store then. Probably gonna look stupid, right? Like a big turd with a door on the front, right? What do you think it should look like?

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: Um, it might be fun if each store had a different theme, like a beach one, a winter one, a jungle one.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No, not a big fan of the winter aesthetic.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: Well that was just one idea. It doesn't have to be winter.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, no, it does. It does. It has to be winter, and I reject it. So I drew up a design concept. Probably gonna be rubbish, right? Would you like to look at it? Just so you could laugh at it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Let me just get the projector working.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh. [eats antacids]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You got to stop with the antacids. It's not the antidote.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You didn't poison me, it's just stress.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is the antidote?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: True love's kiss.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Jim, help me lower this screen. You're a big, tall man. [points to Ryan] You'd be hilarious trying to do it, like a little boy. Just let go of his balloon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll do it! I always say, "You want something done right? Ask Dwight." Right? Dwight. Right? Dwight. Right Dwight, right Dwight. Sorry, now you'll never be able to get that out of your head. [reaches up, whimpers]

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I can do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm! [screams, pulls down screen] There we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes, a complete inability to pass gas, pervert. Ugh, yeah, it's tender. It can't be appendicitis, I eat more than enough bacon. Okay, what poison mimics the symptoms of appendicitis? Oh, you don't know? Hold on. [to Jim] What kind of poison did you use?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, I didn't poison you. I was kidding.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm gonna need an ambulance. Hold on, I have the address in my phone. [sees chart on screen] Hold on. Hold on one second. Uh, quick question. Vice president, uh, who is that? There's no name listed.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Is there not? Maybe I'm just waiting for someone to wow me. [winks]

quotes.speaker: Emergency Operator
quotes.text: Sir? Sir, where should we send the ambulance?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Send it to the frickin' moon, idiot.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I tell you what though, since my move down to Florida I've really gotten back into hunting big time.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Hunting's so primal. Almost sexual.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Totally. I mean, I'd never bang an animal, you can hardly tell the difference between a boy or a girl, you know, but hunting's intense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You talking about hunting? I love hunting. I'm a master hunter.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Did you say "masturbator?"

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm a decent baiter. My cousin Mose, that's a master baiter.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Why are you sitting down like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why is everyone else standing up? Okay team, let's get back to work! Break's over!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Are you that bored?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's just rum. I'm not bored, I'm a pirate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that another motto?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's whatever you want. [offers Jim the bottle]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Or do you only drink with your kids?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, let's do it. [laughs] Oh, that's healthy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I've spent so much of my life telling myself "Please, don't end up like Stanley," and now I'm wondering if I even have what it takes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: We have the Sabre Pyramid, right? Hmm? We've got a bunch of humans. You guys, humans... pyramid. Human pyramid. Do you follow? It's a team-building exercise. You'll love it. Who's in? Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Yup. Tallahassee, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Jim, are you in?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Sounds like a hoot. I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, what the heck? Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: This is great. This is gonna be great.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I feel like I'm in ancient Egypt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll be on top. It's the most important position.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dude, I think you have appendicitis.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [tries to climb human pyramid] Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, why don't we just hold off with the human pyramids for a while?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everyone stop moving! Everyone stop wiggling! Oh, I feel like I'm gonna vomit!

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Dude, don't you yak on me. This shirt is Van Heusen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [groans] Stop moving!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No one's moving!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh! [collapses]

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oh, oh! [general commotion]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Arrest Jim. He poisoned me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wha- no. No, it was not a poisoning.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The one thing Pam made sure I knew, Florida's pretty loose with the death penalty.

quotes.speaker: Paramedic
quotes.text: You need an operation. You have appendicitis.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh! Who called it? Nothin' but net.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How long will he be gone?

quotes.speaker: Paramedic
quotes.text: Two or three days.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't remember me like this. Remember me as the man who pulled down the screen.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Drama queen, am I right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to phone] Phillip, if you're hearing this memo, that can only mean one thing, I'm dead. You are the rightful heir to Schrute Farms. Please, you must do one thing. Kill Mose before he kills you. [presses button] Mose, hey, it's Dwight. Listen, yeah, I just want to give you a heads-up.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: That was an interesting diversion. Shall we get back to the meeting?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whoa, are those mini pizzas?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I figured we'd keep things savory while Oscar's mouth is in canker country. I also have some bacon-wrapped dates on deck.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Look at these little mini pizzas. Does this make me look huge? [giggles] Hey guys, look at me, I'm huge.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Darryl, good news, your fax went through.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh [bleep] yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Up high.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes sir. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Andy. [whispers to Kelly] I put out some new magazines, check it out.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Ah, Dwell.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm acting like I like reception and I'm a really good actor, so people are actually buying that I actually like reception, but, I mean, seriously, reception sucks. [phone rings] Oh, there's the phone!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just got out of surgery. What's going on? Fill me in.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, we broke into groups and the groups are doing presentations later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who's doing the presentations?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Packer's giving one. [Dwight growls] Jim'll probably give ours, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Let's see, what else have you missed? Ryan switched his name tag to his pants, so now it's like if you wear yours on your shirt, you're a total dip, but if you switch, you're a copycat. But I think I figured out a solution. What else? My shoes are gonna-

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: -features a tech support area. Bring in your product, a bunch of nerdy virgins fix it on the spot. Huge for building loyalty.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Very good point.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah Todd, decent idea. Obvious, but interesting.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, are you all right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm great. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's our presentation about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, will you go back to the hospital? You were there for like three hours.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got the surgery, what else is there to do?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do a hundred jumping jacks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I don't feel like it. You do a hundred jumping jacks.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't feel like it either!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [doing jumping jacks] Ninety-seven, ninety-eight, ninety-nine-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want that vice-presidency.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You haven't done any of the research.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "You're too slow, you're too small, Seabiscuit is a stupid name." You guys sound just like the enemies of Seabiscuit. I'm going to do it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Aw, let him do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stanley, are you listening to music?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, who's ready for the next presentation?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ah, what is your topic?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is our topic? Oh, what a topic it is.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Retail consumer habits.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? Okay. Retail consumer habits is... [sighs] The only thing you need to know about retail consumer habits is that consumers are mindless lemmings. They just want to be told what to do. [Erin makes the first slide appear] Fast forward to today, and the retail consumer is independent, well-informed, super smart. Super smart. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shopping habits are both seasonal and cyclical. What does this mean?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can field this one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, sit down. "Seasonal." Well, the Christmas shopping season is certainly a busy one, back-to-school is, as well, and in early summer it seems to slow down a bit, but shopping is also cyclical. The menstrual cycle determines every choice a woman makes. You see, during ovulation, a woman's only goal is to get pregnant, and during menses, she is sad that she has failed. And how does the woman console herself? Shopping. Shopping. Just- Jim, could you fetch me some ice chips? Thank you. Just gonna... take a... brief pause at this point. [Jim gives Dwight a bowl of ice chips] Thank you. [Dwight sticks his head in the bowl] Oh, God. Next slide.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mail call! [sings] His name is Oscar, and he got some mail, and he better open it, or go to jail 'cause it's your taxes. His name is Kevin, and no mail for him, but he got a coupon, for some frozen... yogurt.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are those the lyrics?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Anderson's three pillars of retail. Crucial. So important. Next. Are there any questions?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What are the three pillars of retail?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [whispers] Convenience.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ingredients.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Service.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Burgers.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Building loyalty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Killing royalty. The truth be told, we should really disregard Anderson's three pillars. He was later diagnosed with dementia. You know what is important? Is Dwight's pillars, and there is only one: desire. Do we have a desire to dominate the retail space? Not just succeed in it, but to dominate, and looking around this room I'm not so sure that we do, but we can get there, and I can lead us there, and that is all that matters.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Very true. Where there's a will, there's a way. I once spent a passionate night with Hugh Grant's brother, John Grant. He's older than Hugh, just a little bit uglier. How did I pull that off? Sheer force of will. That is very good, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you very much. Any other questions? Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are bleeding through your shirt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oops. That's embarrassing. Egg on my face. [ties jacket around wound] Ah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, having fun?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes I am, as a matter of fact.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well I know how it is. I know it's a lot of fun. I don't know how it is. Andy, this is a lame job. What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I found my calling.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy, when I was twelve years old, we did a field trip, a lock-in at the zoo. I met this girl, I thought she was so perfect. I was in love with her. But when the sun came up, I knew it wasn't real, 'cause she was ugly and I had grown tired of her. I know you want reception today, but tomorrow you won't want to do her. She's a dog.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Guys, I don't like this analogy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [groans] Ugh! Fine. Did you see this? [points to pens in cup]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean... [Pam giggles]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: How are you feeling?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Amazing. Just lost four ounces of appendix, already replaced it with muscle.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Can I see the wound?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [show her the wound] Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh! That's disgusting. That's barely healed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're not paying me to heal, you're paying me to kick ass.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: A few hours ago, your body was open like a cabinet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's right.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That is amazing. Todd, look at that.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Oh, yikes. Incoming- [tries to touch the wound]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah! Not so fast.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Would you come in early tomorrow so we can talk about the store over breakfast? I feel you [points to both] have a lot to offer.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: It would be an honor, ma'am.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll go ahead and cancel my post-op check-up right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had two goals today. The first was to make myself the clear candidate for vice president. I achieved that, no thanks to my appendix. The second was to find a memorable souvenir for Philip. For that, I do have to thank my appendix.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [answers the reception phone] Dunder Mifflin, how can I help you save money on paper? This is Andrew.

quotes.speaker: Donna Muraski
quotes.text: Hi Andrew. What happened to Erin?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, she's on an assignment in Florida for a couple of weeks.

quotes.speaker: Donna Muraski
quotes.text: Oh, good for her. She's such a sweetheart. You tell her Donna Muraski misses her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I miss her too.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Everyone, we have a very special guest. He turned an idea into a store, into hundreds of stores. I give you Wally Amos, founder of Famous Amos Cookies. [cheers, claps]

quotes.speaker: Wally Amos
quotes.text: Aloha, aloha, aloha. So I hear you're all looking to bake up some dough in the sales game. Well, back when I was regular Amos-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What's under the cloth?

quotes.speaker: Wally Amos
quotes.text: We'll get to that.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Cookies. Bet you anything it's cookies.

quotes.speaker: Wally Amos
quotes.text: It's cookies. Let me- let me finish my speech first.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ah, we get the gist. It's just success and effort, isn't it? So just, don't be coy, make with the cookies! [everyone goes for the cookies]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Famous, hi. I'm sure you get ideas for new cookies all the time, but I-

quotes.speaker: Wally Amos
quotes.text: Is it oatmeal with no raisins?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm sorry to have wasted your time.
